entry.title: Facing F4 Help issue in object page of RAP Application
entry.content:
SAP System version - S4 HANA 2022
system's - SAP UI5 version - 1.108
code snippet -

Please help me to solve this issue.
I have used Odata v2 where im facing this issue, but in Odata V4 there is no issue.

entry.title: How to upload Classification Characteristic Values to Document Info Record
entry.content:
Hi Experts,

the API Documents | Document Info Record | SAP Business Accelerator Hub  allows the creation of document info records using an OData Service. 

The API also allows the retrieval of the classification of a document info record (" Item node that contains classification values. Only Read operation is supported ")

We currently have an option to create the document info record and upload/link attachments via an API via an connected system. But the maintenance of the of classification of the document and valuation of the characteristics must be done manual in the system. 

Is there also an API to maintain values to a classification characteristic? 

Thank you for the help.

Florian

entry.title: Unsupported media type 415 error when using cap-js/attachment via HTTP POST
entry.content:
I'm trying to upload an attachment via HTTP POST OData call to my CAP service entity that has an extended Attachments field/association from cap-js/attachments via a React external app, but I'm encountering a 415 HTTP error code. I can successfully create an entry to my main entity, but I'm unable to create an attachment due to the 415 error. Has anyone encountered this?

So far the terminal logs isn't showing any error, only in the browser.

entry.title: Reading GOS(Generic Object Services) in MM03
entry.content:
Hi  @everyone , Recently I was working on an small project where i have to develop an application where you can create, read and delete GOS attachment in mm03 for specific material.

This post is specific to reading GOS in mm03 using material and business object type.

   DATA : it_tab   TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_name_value_pair,          
          gv_matnr TYPE matnr.
    DATA: gs_lpor TYPE sibflporb.
    DATA: lt_relat   TYPE obl_t_relt,
          la_relat   LIKE LINE OF lt_relat,
          lt_xstring TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF xstring,
          lv_xstring TYPE xstring.
    DATA: t_links  TYPE obl_t_link,
          la_links LIKE LINE OF t_links.
    DATA: lo_root TYPE REF TO cx_root,
          l_folder_id TYPE soodk,
          l_object_id TYPE soodk,
          document_id TYPE sofmk.
    DATA : range_ls_matnr TYPE RANGE OF matnr,
           ls_matnr       LIKE LINE OF range_ls_matnr,
           doc_id         TYPE sibfboriid.
    DATA : it_sort_data TYPE SORTED TABLE OF zzstructure
            WITH UNIQUE KEY matnr image,
           it_data      TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zzstructure.
           wa_data      TYPE zzstructure.
    DATA: et_attachments     TYPE zzstructure(line types),
          et_attach_bid_quot TYPE zzstructure,
          et_attach          TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zzstructure(strucure).

    DATA : ls_select_option         TYPE /iwbep/s_mgw_select_option,
           ls_select_internal_table TYPE /iwbep/t_cod_select_options,
           wa_select_option         TYPE /iwbep/s_cod_select_option.

 " we will have matnr as input here i have an odata service which is 
 " get entity set which is providing all the gos attachemnt in that material 
 " in mm03. 
READ TABLE it_filter_select_options INTO ls_select_option WITH KEY property = 'Matnr'.
    IF ls_select_option-property IS NOT INITIAL.
      ls_select_internal_table[] = ls_select_option-select_options[].

      LOOP AT ls_select_internal_table INTO wa_select_option.
        ls_matnr-sign = wa_select_option-sign.
        ls_matnr-option = wa_select_option-option.
        ls_matnr-low = wa_select_option-low.
        ls_matnr-high = wa_select_option-high.
        gv_matnr = ls_matnr-low.
        APPEND ls_matnr TO range_ls_matnr.
        CLEAR : wa_select_option , ls_matnr.
      ENDLOOP.
*      gv_matnr = it_tab-value.
      gs_lpor-instid = gv_matnr.
      gs_lpor-typeid = 'BUS1001006'.
      gs_lpor-catid  = 'BO'.
      la_relat-sign = 'I'.
      la_relat-option = 'EQ'.
      la_relat-low = 'ATTA'.
      APPEND la_relat TO lt_relat.

      doc_id = CONV sibfboriid( gv_matnr ).

      CALL FUNCTION 'ZREADGOS'
        EXPORTING
          business_object    = 'BUS1001006'
          document_number    = doc_id
        IMPORTING
          et_attachments     = ET_aTTACHMENTS
          et_attach_bid_quot = et_attach_bid_quot.

      DATA: ls_attachment TYPE ZSREAD_GOS,
            output        TYPE string.

*READ TABLE et_attachments INTO ls_attachment INDEX 1.
*IF sy-subrc = 0.
*  lv_xstring = ls_attachment-file_content. " Assuming file_content is of type XSTRING
*ENDIF.
      LOOP AT et_attachments INTO ls_attachment.
        IF ls_attachment-file_content IS NOT INITIAL.
          lv_xstring = ls_attachment-file_content.
          CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_BASE64_ENCODE_STR'
            EXPORTING
              input  = lv_xstring
            IMPORTING
              output = output.
          wa_data-brelguid = ls_attachment-brelguid.
          wa_data-instid_a = ls_attachment-instid_a.
          wa_data-instid_b = ls_attachment-instid_b.
          wa_data-roletype_a = ls_attachment-roletype_a.
          wa_data-typeid_a   = ls_attachment-typeid_a.
          wa_data-typeid_b = ls_attachment-typeid_b.
          wa_data-name =    ls_attachment-name.
          wa_data-image = lv_xstring.
          wa_data-base  = output.
          wa_data-matnr = gv_matnr.
          APPEND wa_data TO it_data.
        ENDIF.
        CLEAR : lv_xstring , wa_data , output , ls_attachment.
      ENDLOOP.
    ENDIF.

 

Reading the gos fm :

FUNCTION ZREADGOS.
*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     VALUE(BUSINESS_OBJECT) TYPE  SIBFTYPEID
*"     VALUE(DOCUMENT_NUMBER) TYPE  SIBFBORIID
*"  EXPORTING
*"     VALUE(ET_ATTACHMENTS) TYPE  ZSTRUCURE
*"     VALUE(ET_ATTACH_BID_QUOT) TYPE  ZSTRUCTURE
*" ZSTRUCTURE : 
*"  BRELGUID	Types	OS_GUID	RAW
*"  ROLETYPE_A	Types	OBLROLTYPE	CHAR
*"  INSTID_A	Types	SIBFBORIID	CHAR
*"  TYPEID_A	Types	SIBFTYPEID	CHAR
*"  INSTID_B	Types	SIBFBORIID	CHAR
*" TYPEID_B	Types	SIBFTYPEID	CHAR
*" MATNR	Types	MATNR	        CHAR
*" FILE_NAME	Types		        STRING
*" FILE_TYPE	Types		        STRING
*" FILE_CONTENT	Types		        RAWSTRING
*" FILE_EXT	Types	SAEDOKTYP	CHAR
*" ERDAT	Types	ERDAT	        DATS
*" ERNAM	Types	ERNAM	        CHAR
*" NAME	        Types		        STRING
*" MESSAGE	Types		        STRING
MESSAGE_TYPE	Types		STRING
*"
*"

*"----------------------------------------------------------------------
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
*&---------------------------------------------------------------------*
  DATA : ls_lporb       TYPE sibflporb,
         lt_link        TYPE obl_t_link,
         ls_link        TYPE LINE OF obl_t_link,
         lv_document_id TYPE  sofolenti1-doc_id.
  DATA : mime      TYPE mimetypes-type,
         lt_string TYPE string_table,
         ls_string TYPE string,
         lv_line   TYPE i.
  DATA : lo_header    TYPE REF TO cl_bcs_objhead,
         lv_filename1 TYPE string.

  DATA lt_object_content  TYPE swftlisti1.
  DATA lt_contents_hex    TYPE solix_tab.
  DATA lv_xstring         TYPE xstring.
  DATA lv_filename        TYPE string.
  DATA lv_mime_type       TYPE string.
  DATA: lo_wi_api         TYPE REF TO if_swr_workitem_api.
  DATA: lt_rfc           TYPE swrtsystem,
        ls_rfc           TYPE swrssystem,
        ls_document_data TYPE sofolenti1.
  DATA : lt_object_header TYPE TABLE OF solisti1.
  DATA : ls_object_header TYPE solisti1.
  DATA: ls_attachment TYPE ZSREAD_GOS.

  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <fs_contents_hex>   LIKE LINE OF lt_contents_hex.

  ls_lporb-instid = document_number.
  ls_lporb-typeid = business_object.
  ls_lporb-catid = 'BO'.

  TRY.
      CALL METHOD cl_binary_relation=>read_links_of_binrel
        EXPORTING
          is_object   = ls_lporb
          ip_relation = 'ATTA'
          ip_role     = 'GOSAPPLOBJ'
        IMPORTING
          et_links    = lt_link.
    CATCH cx_root.
  ENDTRY.


  LOOP AT lt_link INTO ls_link.
    lv_document_id = ls_link-instid_b.
    CALL FUNCTION 'SO_DOCUMENT_READ_API1'
      EXPORTING
        document_id                = lv_document_id
      IMPORTING
        document_data              = ls_document_data
      TABLES
        object_header              = lt_object_header
        object_content             = lt_object_content
        contents_hex               = lt_contents_hex
      EXCEPTIONS
        document_id_not_exist      = 1
        operation_no_authorization = 2
        x_error                    = 3
        OTHERS                     = 4.

* build xstring for binary file
    IF lt_contents_hex[] IS NOT INITIAL.
      LOOP AT lt_contents_hex ASSIGNING <fs_contents_hex>.
        CONCATENATE lv_xstring <fs_contents_hex>-line INTO lv_xstring IN BYTE MODE.
      ENDLOOP.
      IF lt_object_header[] IS NOT INITIAL.
        lo_header = cl_bcs_objhead=>create( lt_object_header ).
        IF  lo_header  IS BOUND.
          lv_filename1 = lo_header->get_filename( ).
          CALL FUNCTION 'ZZFILENAME'
            EXPORTING
              complete_filename = lv_filename1
            IMPORTING
              extension         = ls_attachment-file_ext
              name              = ls_attachment-file_name
            EXCEPTIONS
              invalid_drive     = 1
              invalid_path      = 2
              OTHERS            = 3.
          CLEAR lv_filename1.
        ENDIF.
      ENDIF.
    ELSEIF lt_object_content[] IS NOT INITIAL.
              lo_header = cl_bcs_objhead=>create( lt_object_header ).
        IF  lo_header  IS BOUND.
          lv_filename1 = lo_header->get_filename( ).
        endif.
        CALL FUNCTION 'ZZFILENAME'
            EXPORTING
              complete_filename = lv_filename1
            IMPORTING
              extension         = ls_attachment-file_ext
              name              = ls_attachment-file_name
            EXCEPTIONS
              invalid_drive     = 1
              invalid_path      = 2
              OTHERS            = 3.

          CLEAR lv_filename1.
      CALL FUNCTION 'SCMS_TEXT_TO_XSTRING'
        IMPORTING
          buffer   = lv_xstring
        TABLES
          text_tab = lt_object_content
        EXCEPTIONS
          failed   = 1
          OTHERS   = 2.
    ENDIF.

    ls_attachment-file_content = lv_xstring.
    ls_attachment-erdat = ls_document_data-creat_date.
    ls_attachment-name = ls_document_data-creat_fnam.
    ls_attachment-brelguid = ls_link-brelguid.
    ls_attachment-instid_a = ls_link-instid_a.
    ls_attachment-instid_b = ls_link-instid_b.
    ls_attachment-matnr = CONV matnr( document_number ).
    ls_attachment-roletype_a = ls_link-roletype_a.
    ls_attachment-typeid_a = ls_link-typeid_a.
    ls_attachment-typeid_b = ls_link-typeid_b.

TRANSLATE ls_attachment-file_ext TO UPPER CASE."pHANIDRA
    SELECT SINGLE mimetype FROM toadd
      INTO ls_attachment-file_type
       WHERE doc_type EQ ls_attachment-file_ext.

    APPEND ls_attachment TO et_attachments.

    CLEAR:lt_contents_hex[], lv_document_id, ls_document_data,
          lt_object_content[], ls_link, lv_xstring, ls_attachment .
  ENDLOOP.
  ENDLOOP.
ENDFUNCTION.

 FM ZZFILENAME :

FUNCTION ZZFILENAME.
*"--------------------------------------------------------------------
*"*"Local Interface:
*"  IMPORTING
*"     VALUE(COMPLETE_FILENAME) TYPE  STRING
*"     VALUE(CHECK_DOS_FORMAT) LIKE  RC27X-FLG_SEL OPTIONAL
*"  EXPORTING
*"     VALUE(DRIVE) LIKE  PCFILE-DRIVE
*"     VALUE(EXTENSION)
*"     VALUE(NAME)
*"     VALUE(NAME_WITH_EXT)
*"     VALUE(PATH) TYPE  STRING
*"  EXCEPTIONS
*"      INVALID_DRIVE
*"      INVALID_PATH
*"--------------------------------------------------------------------

*................ Local Data Declaration  ........................*

  DATA: offset    TYPE i,              "// length of the string

        head   TYPE string,       "// Drive
        tail   TYPE string,       "// Path
        puffer TYPE string OCCURS 0 WITH HEADER LINE,
                                    "// Internal Table to hold the paths
        dot(1) TYPE c.                 "// Dot Extension

  FIELD-SYMBOLS: <c>.

*......................................................................*


*-- Convert the filename from '/' to '\',if required                 --*

  TRANSLATE complete_filename USING '/\'.
  tail = complete_filename.

  IF tail CS ':'.
*-- Split the filename into drive and filepath-------------------------*

    SPLIT tail AT ':' INTO head tail.

*-- Check whether drive is valid or not                              --*

    offset = strlen( head ).
    IF offset > 1.
      RAISE invalid_drive.
    ENDIF.

    drive = head.

    CALL FUNCTION 'PC_CHECK_DRIVE'
         EXPORTING
              idrive        = drive
         IMPORTING
              edrive        = drive
         EXCEPTIONS
              invalid_drive = 1.

    IF sy-subrc <> 0.
      RAISE invalid_drive.
    ENDIF.
  ENDIF.

*-- Get the filename and path------------------------------------------*
  SPLIT tail AT '\' INTO TABLE puffer.
  offset = strlen( tail ) - 1.
  SHIFT tail BY offset PLACES LEFT.
  IF tail = '\'.
    APPEND INITIAL LINE TO puffer.
  ENDIF.
  CLEAR tail.
  DESCRIBE TABLE puffer LINES sy-tfill.
  offset = sy-tfill - 1.
  LOOP AT puffer TO offset.
    CONCATENATE tail puffer '\' INTO tail.
  ENDLOOP.
  DESCRIBE TABLE puffer LINES sy-tfill.
  READ TABLE puffer INDEX sy-tfill.

  IF puffer IS INITIAL.
*-- Check whether the filename is present or not-------*
    CLEAR name.
    CLEAR name_with_ext.
  ELSE.
    CLEAR dot.
*-- Check whether the filename has an extension or not     --*

    IF NOT puffer CS '.'.
*-- Transfer only the name value (no extension present)----------------*
      name = puffer.
      CLEAR extension.
*-- Transfer the name and extension value  ---------------------*
    ELSE.
      dot = '.'.
      SPLIT puffer AT '.' INTO name extension.
    ENDIF.
*-- Build the filename with extension  ---------------------*

    CONCATENATE name dot extension INTO name_with_ext.
  ENDIF.
*-- Check the path of the file ?  ---------------------*

  offset = strlen( tail ).
  IF offset > 0.

*-- Convert the filename from '/' to '\',if required  ---*
        TRANSLATE tail USING '/\'.
        path = tail.

  ENDIF.



ENDFUNCTION.

entry.title: Deleting GOS in MM03
entry.content:
This is followed post of reading GOS:

Reading GOS(Generic Object Services) in MM03 - SAP Community

" this will be put call for the same project where i am directly passing
" the doc_id , instid_a and instid_b form read call , will say because the 
" development are inter-dependent if you have to read the gos then you can
" delete the gos using same inputs that you have after reading the gos
" for specific material. 

  DATA : ls_data TYPE zzstructure,
         lt_data TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF zzstructure.
    " Read input from the request
    io_data_provider->read_entry_data( IMPORTING es_data = ls_data ).
    DATA(ls_object_a) = VALUE borident(
        objkey  = ls_data-instid_a
        objtype = ls_data-typeid_a ).

    DATA(ls_object_b) = VALUE borident(
        objkey  = ls_data-instid_b
        objtype = ls_data-typeid_b ).
    CALL FUNCTION 'BINARY_RELATION_DELETE'
      EXPORTING
        obj_rolea          = ls_object_a
        obj_roleb          = ls_object_b
        relationtype       = 'ATTA'
*       FIRE_EVENTS        = 'X'
      EXCEPTIONS
        entry_not_existing = 1
        internal_error     = 2
        no_relation        = 3
        no_role            = 4
        OTHERS             = 5.

    DATA:ls_folder_id TYPE soodk,
         ls_object_id TYPE soodk.

    ls_folder_id-objtp = ls_data-instid_b+0(3).
    ls_folder_id-objyr = ls_data-instid_b+3(2).
    ls_folder_id-objno = ls_data-instid_b+5(12).

    ls_object_id-objtp =  ls_data-instid_b+17(3).
    ls_object_id-objyr =  ls_data-instid_b+20(2).
    ls_object_id-objno =  ls_data-instid_b+22(12).

    CALL FUNCTION 'SO_OBJECT_DELETE'
      EXPORTING
        folder_id                  = ls_folder_id
        object_id                  = ls_object_id
      EXCEPTIONS
        communication_failure      = 1
        folder_not_empty           = 2
        folder_not_exist           = 3
        folder_no_authorization    = 4
        forwarder_not_exist        = 5
        object_not_exist           = 6
        object_no_authorization    = 7
        operation_no_authorization = 8
        owner_not_exist            = 9
        substitute_not_active      = 10
        substitute_not_defined     = 11
        system_failure             = 12
        x_error                    = 13
        OTHERS                     = 14.

    IF sy-subrc = 0.
      ls_data-message = 'Deleted Successfully !!'.
      ls_data-message_type = 'S'.
      COMMIT WORK AND WAIT.
    ELSE.
      ls_data-message = 'Deleted FAILED !!'.
      ls_data-message_type = 'E'.
    ENDIF.

entry.title: Issue Accessing SAP OData v2 API
entry.content:

I am trying to access the SAP OData v2 API but am not getting a successful response.
OData Service URL I'm trying to access:

https://******.de1.test.crm.cloud.sap/sap/c4c/odata/v2/c4codataapi

I’m using Basic Auth (username/password).
And when using Postman, I get

Is the service URL correct for accessing the OData v2 API?
Are there any special roles or permissions I need to configure in the SAP tenant?
Is there a way to test or verify that the OData service is exposed and active?

Any help or suggestions would be appreciated!
Thanks in advance.

entry.title: FIORI Url as Oauth2 through OKTA IDP
entry.content:
I am reaching out to seek assistance regarding the configuration of the Fiori URL as OAuth2. I have successfully created a profile through Tcode OA2C_CONFIG and have integrated OKTA as the Identity Provider (IDP). Additionally, I can obtain an Access token via Tcode OA2C_GRANT, and the flow is properly directing to the Fiori URL.

However, I am encountering an issue with the Fiori link that appears following the redirection. When I open the URL in a new private browser session, it initially directs me to the OKTA login details, which is expected. Yet, after redirecting to the Fiori URL, it prompts for SAP credentials. Ideally, the authentication should solely occur via the OKTA token without requiring any SAP credentials.

I would like to bring to your attention that I have already set up the email in the user alias through SU01, which I am using in OKTA.

Additionally, I have experimented with different logon methods for Fiori through SICF. When I selected Basic authentication, it still requests SAP credentials, and for other logon methods, I am receiving an unauthorized error.

Could you please provide guidance or support on resolving this issue? I appreciate your assistance in advance.

entry.title: S/4 Cloud: Is there a way to clear/refresh the metadata cache of a custom service?
entry.content:
Hi community,

is there a way to cleanup/clear/refresh the metadata cache (including annotations) for a custom OData service?

I'm talking about services which are annotated with UI annotations for Fiori Elements apps.

A lot of times when we build RAP services, we add or change annotations to handle requirements. For most of the annotations (like UI.lineItem or UI.selectionField) the changes are immediately active for the generated frontend UI (Fiori Elements). But in some cases the changes are not immediately taking effect. If we then wait a day, it works.

To me it looks like that in such a case the metadata of the service is cached on the backend (nothing related to browser cache) and just takes some time until it gets reset automatically. I know from On-Prem systems, that there are reports for this which are planned as jobs on a daily basis. For S/4 Cloud (Public Cloud) I don't see any option how to trigger a refresh. We sometimes try to unpublish the service and republish it again: this works sometimes, sometimes not.

Our current example is the annotation "hidden" (inside a UI.facet entry): Once activated it took effect. But I deactivated the annotation (took it out completely) and it still affects the generated Fiori Elements app. I'm sure that after 1-2 days the metadata will get refreshed and everything is fine. The issue is, that we cannot be sure if we found a solution for a requirement or not, if we cannot be sure that the changes made, are getting considered or not.

Long story short, I'm wondering if there is anyway to trigger a refresh of the service on S/4 Cloud (I guess an admin app which does something like the report /UI5/UPD_ODATA_METADATA_CACHE on prem).

Thank you
Daniel

entry.title: How to get the list of available SuccessFactors oData v4 services
entry.content:
Hello,

I'm getting into the oData v4 API for Successfactors instances.

If I know the path of a service (ex: /odatav4/talent/cdp/Learning.svc/v1/) I can then get the available resources using the $metadata keyword like this: /odatav4/talent/cdp/Learning.svc/v1/$metadata?$format=json

My question : is there a way, using a similar approach, to get the list of available services?  For example I tried /odatav4/$metadata?$format=json but it doesn't work.

Thanks!

Louis

entry.title: System query option '$count' not supported on expand
entry.content:
Hello,

When I try to use the operation $count into an $expand in an OData V4 call for an SAP  API :

/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0001/Product?$expand=_ProductUnitOfMeasure($count=true)

I have the following error : 501 : Not Implemented
System query option '$count' not supported on expand

 

 

For other operation, like "select" for example, it's working well :

/sap/opu/odata4/sap/api_product/srvd_a2x/sap/product/0001/Product?$expand=_ProductUnitOfMeasure($select=QuantityNumerator)

Regarding documentation, "count" seems to be an operation supported by OData : https://docs.oasis-open.org/odata/odata/v4.01/odata-v4.01-part1-protocol.html#sec_SystemQueryOptionexpand

Any idea ?

entry.title: Flexible Programming Model Explorer - Building Blocks with Variant Management
entry.content:
Dear Community,

We have an interesting problem.

We developed a SAP Custom Page and Building Blocks ODatav4 and use macros:VariantManagement for Change Documents following the provided instructions?(Building Blocks with Variant Management)

The app show one error message: The "VariantManagement" class doesn't exist in the "sap.fe.macros" namespace.

 

Any insights or suggestions would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you!

entry.title: [Student Project] TypeError in Analytical List Page with OData V4
entry.content:
Hello SAP Community,

I'm a student working on my end-of-study project and need your help with a Fiori issue. I'm developing an Analytical List Page using OData V4 service  with BTP Trial  and encountering a JavaScript error.

Context:
- App Type: Analytical List Page (ALP)
- Service: OData V4
- This is part of my final academic project

Problem:
I'm getting a TypeError: "Cannot read properties of undefined (reading 'map')" when the FilterBar building block is being processed. The error occurs in the library-preload.js file.

Error Details:
trace info in the image :

 

{
"initialProperties": {
"showMessages": false,
"variantBackreference": "fe::PageVariantManagement",
"enableFallback": false,
"showAdaptFiltersButton": true,
"p13nMode": "Item,Value",
"useSemanticDateRange": true,
"liveMode": false,
"suspendSelection": true,
"isDraftCollaborative": false,
"initialLayout": "compact",
"showClearButton": false,
"_applyIdToContent": true,
"disableDraftEditStateFilter": false,
"internalFilterChanged": ".handlers.onFiltersChanged",
"internalSearch": ".handlers.onSearch",
"afterClear": ".onAfterClear"
},
"resolvedProperties": {
"contextPath": {
"path": "/zc_eee/",
"value": {
"$kind": "EntityType",
"$Key": [
"id"
],
"id": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 60
},
"equipment": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"division_loc": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"secteur_exp": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"categ_equip": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"type_objet": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 18
},
"date_debut": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Date"
},
"date_fin": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Date"
},
"heures_marche": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 15,
"$Scale": 3
},
"heures_pannes": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 6,
"$Scale": 1





},
"heures_entretien": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 6,
"$Scale": 1
},
"heures_repos": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.Decimal",
"$Nullable": false,
"$Precision": 15,
"$Scale": 3
},
"unit_of_measure": {
"$kind": "Property",
"$Type": "Edm.String",
"$Nullable": false,
"$MaxLength": 3
}
}
},
"isPublic": false
},
"missingContexts": {}
}

 

 

here is my cds from the abap : 

 

@AbapCatalog.sqlViewName: 'ZCEEE'
@AbapCatalog.compiler.compareFilter: true
@AbapCatalog.preserveKey: true
@AccessControl.authorizationCheck: #NOT_REQUIRED
@EndUserText.label: 'eeee'
@Metadata.ignorePropagatedAnnotations: true
define view zc_eee as select from ZC_EQUIPMENT_SELECTION as e 
{

  @ui.hidden: true                                  
  key e.id,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 10 }]
  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 10 }]           
  e.equipment,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 20, label: 'Division localisation' }]
  @Consumption.valueHelpDefinition: [
    { entity: { name: 'ZC_EQUIPMENT_LOC', element: 'LocationDivision' } }
  ]
  e.division_loc,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 30, label: 'Secteur' }]
  e.secteur_exp,

  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 40, label: 'category ' }]
  e.categ_equip,

  e.type_objet,

  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 20 }]          
  e.date_debut,

  @ui.selectionField: [{ position: 30 }]           
  e.date_fin,

  /* mesures agrégées */
  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 50 }]
  e.heures_marche,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  @ui.lineItem: [{ position: 60 }]
  e.heures_pannes,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  e.heures_entretien,

  @DefaultAggregation: #SUM
  @Semantics.quantity.unitOfMeasure: 'unit_of_measure'
  e.heures_repos,

  e.unite as unit_of_measure

}

at D.runAsOwner (Component-dbg.js:806:24)

 

What I've tried:
i tried to  take off the  filters from the CDS and regenerated new  app Fiori  but the  problem  persist ,  when  i try  to  make the preview form the Eclipse  , the  interface shows up  with no error !  

Question:
What could be causing this 'map' property to be undefined in the FilterBar context? Are there specific annotations or configurations I should check in my CDS view or service?

As a student, I would greatly appreciate any guidance or suggestions from the community!

entry.title: UnManaged RAP CDS Odata V4 - JSON array POST method
entry.content:
Hi,

  I have an Unmanaged RAP "Behavior Definition" public on Odatav4 Service Binding:

unmanaged implementation in class <my_class> unique;
strict ( 2 );
define behavior for <my_cds>
lock master
authorization master ( instance )
{
create;
}

In Create Method:

LOOP AT entities ASSIGNING FIELD-SYMBOL(<fs>).
* my checks
ENDLOOP.

In this example My_Cds have only 2 fields: test (key), description.

POSTMAN test:

When I try to send POST method with JSON Body with single entity work good:

 {
    "test": "001",
     "description": "Hello"
 }
When I try to send array entities like this:
[
   {
     "test": "001",
     "description": "Hello"
   },
   {
      "test": "002",
      "description": "Hello hello"
    }
]
The service response with 400 BadRequest:
 "message": {
            "lang": "en",
            "value": "Error while parsing an XML stream"
        }
 
I don't understand... Is JSON array correct?
On RAP Model, with unmanaged "Behavior Definition", can I send array records in Insert methods or there's a limitation of number of records?
 
Thanks

entry.title: SAP S/4 customer extensibility
entry.content:
Hello colleagues,

we have some customer fields in table VBAP and one of them is PS_PSP_PNR which is used in a lot of places. Now we want to activate all custom fields in standard CDS and OData services, but now getting error, that not possible to enable fields with conversion routine. 

Error: Conversion Exit ABPSP specified on domain PS_POSNR not allowed in S/4 HANA.

Any idea, how overcome that situation. Thank you

Regards,
Martynas

entry.title: Restrict the app F2175 Find Maintenance Order to show orders that an user is responsible for
entry.content:
Hello Everyone - I would like to restrict the orders displayed in the app, F2175 (Find Maintenance Order). I searched in SAP Community and could not find helpful information. Any pointers on how this can be achieved would be of great help.

Steps:

Access the app from launchpad

Clicking on the GO button should display only orders that I am responsible for.

I know we can do "Adapt Filters" and restrict on our personnel number. But this is a user specific setting. I want to restrict based on "Personnel Number" entered.

Thanks,

Phani

entry.title: Use multiple services in XML annotation with Fiori ELements to implement a Value Help
entry.content:
Hello,

I have an XML annotation file where I want to define a Value Help using Common.ValueList. The Value Help is provided by a separate second service. 

To be able to use this second service, I'm trying to define a reference to this service (see below):

    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/MAIN_SERVICE/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="MAIN_SRV"/>
    </edmx:Reference>
    <edmx:Reference Uri="/sap/opu/odata/VALUE_HELP_SERVICE/$metadata">
        <edmx:Include Namespace="VALUE_HELP_SRV"/>
    </edmx:Reference>

However this gives me the following error message on the Namespace of VALUE_HELP_SRV:

 Unknown Namespace.
Namespace for the metadata must match the one defined in the metadata file: 'MAIN_SRV'.
Namespaces for vocabularies must match the namespace from the supported vocabularies, see User Guide.

 

SAP Fiori Elements OData

entry.title: Reported By doesn't show all users in Request Maintenance App (F1511)
entry.content:
Hello,

When we try to create a "Request Maintenance" using the Request Maintenance App (F1511), my user does not appear in the "Reported By" field. I do have a user account in the S/4HANA environment. We have tried creating an HR Master Record (PA30) and also set up a Business Partner (BP), but none of these steps have resolved the issue.

We are performing this validation in our development system as part of a new EAM project implementation. In the development environment, HR Master data is not synchronized with SuccessFactors, so we do not have access to all HR Master records. For this reason, we are attempting to create users manually.

Any guidance or pointers on how to resolve this would be greatly appreciated.

Thank you,
Phani

entry.title: Do not display deleted line item in sap adobe form output using SAP S4 using Gateway service
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am using SAP gateway service to develope SAP ADOBE form using the interface i want to omit the deleted line item in form output.

I am following the below steps to produce form output.

1. Create PO with 3 line items and save it.

2. Delete 1 line item from the PO and approve it using the Front End and corresponding output is generated in which i have omited    the deleted line item so the output contains 2 line items.

3. Now i change the PO after apprval and delete another line item this time for the change po i should get only the recently deleted line item in the Change PO output i.e only 2 line items.

Could you please let me know from which table in SAP S4 could i use to add logic.
